title: Not attending ISAs
content: I might be missing 3-4 1st ISA tests as I’m going out of station. So is there any provision in PESU that will let me take them at a later time? Or will I never be able to take them at all if I’m absent for them ?

comments.body: If you miss the ISAs, you get assigned a 0 for that test. There are no retests, regardless of the genuineness of the reason to miss the test.
There's no "re-take" you miss you lose.

But i heard juniors have a best of 4 out of the 5 ISAs

So ig it's all cool
we have just two ISAs in the first year

Yikes

So until and unless it's a medical reason with a pre-approved reason, ig you'll be marked 0 for that ISA
Nah bro you can’t miss even for medical reasons it seems
No retakes. Your marks will be 0
